text: Luba Perchyshyn (born Luba Mary Procai; October 10, 1923 â€“ September 7, 2020) was an American businesswoman and crafter. She promoted the art of pysanky (Ukrainian decorated eggs). She was born in Minneapolis. Perchyshyn co- authored several books, including Ukrainian Easter Eggs and How We Make Them (1979) and The Ukrainian Design Book (1999). Perchyshyn's eggs were admired and sold internationally, and were included in White House holiday decorations and events. Perchyshyn died on September 7, 2020 in Minneapolis at the age of 96. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Businesspeople from Minneapolis Category:Writers from Minneapolis
title: Luba Perchyshyn
